gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰੀਤਮ ਕੇ ਮੇਲ ਖੇਲ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਨੇਮ ਕੈ ਪਤੰਗੁ ਦੀਪਕ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਹੂ ਸਮਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Preetam Kay Mayl Khayl Praym Naym Kai Patangu , Deepak Pragaas Jotee Joti Hoo Samaavaee ?
translation: For meeting the dear True Guru, an obedient disciple plays the game of love and merges his self into the light divine of the True Guru in a manner as is done by a moth who perishes on his beloved flame.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਜ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਅਰੁ ਬਿਰਹ ਬਿਓਗ ਬਿਖੈ ਜਲ ਮਿਲਿ ਬਿਛੁਰਤ ਮੀਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਦਿਖਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Sahaj Sanjog Aru Birah Biaog Bikhai , Jal Mili Bichhurat Meen Hui Dikhaavaee ?
translation: The state of a devoted Sikh for meeting with True Guru in order to relish the spiritual ecstasy is like that of a fish in water. And one who is separated from water looks like dying with pangs of separation.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਥਕਤਿ ਚਕਤ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਬਦ ਬੇਧੀ ਕੁਰੰਹਗ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਜਤਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Dakati Chakat Hoi , Sabad Baydhee Kuranhag Jougati Jataavaee ?
translation: Like a deer engrossed in the musical sound of Ghanda Herha, the mind of a true devotee enjoys the divine bliss engrossed in the word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲਿ ਬਿਛੁਰਤ ਅਰੁ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਕਪਟ ਸਨੇਹ ਸਨੋਹੀ ਨ ਕਹਾਵੲੀ ॥੫੫੦॥
transliteration: Mili Bichhurat Aru Sabad Surati Liva , Kapat Sanayh Sanohee N Kahaavaee ?550?
translation: The disciple who is able to engross his mind in the divine word, and yet separates himself from True Guru, his love is false. He cannot be called a true lover.  (550)
